title: Welcome and introduction to the workshop programme / Pozdrav in predstavitev programa delavnice

author: Dunja Mladenić, Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: I suggest that we start.
So that we keep it schedule.
Welcome to the Gender and National Workshop in Slovenia.

I'm very happy you managed to join us, so the theme of the workshop is encourage gender equality policy in Slovenia, and the title is between his Wiener political and acoustics follow, and as already announced in email, will do some presentation in Slovenian, some in English, and then we'll kind of for non Slovenians.
Speakers have improvised interpretation of the presentations.
The reason for that is that we want to have international dimension and hear about experiences of other countries.
At the same time as we would like to keep a kind of national theme emphasized also with the language anhava.
Possibility for lively discussion.
So my name is Daniel had an itch.
I'm from the years of Steven Institute leading artificial intelligence Laboratory and Monica Krape all the way back.
She is in charge of organization from Center for Knowledge Transfer.
So this is the program.
The first session is introduction and background.
First welcome introduction.

An introduction of the project Gendera, which is European project behind this event and I'll talk about that in a few minutes and then we'll hear from Meteor Mall about science on video lectures portal.
And then from Andrea will make Venturini about gender equality in science in Slovenia and in EU.
And then from there a good summary in Church will hear about national Network for developing research values for youth.
And that will be concluded with a coffee break.
After the coffee break, the second session is an examples of good practices of gender policies.
First, Daria Brodnik will talk about gender, a synthesis report, and good some some good practices of Slovenian.
And then that will be followed by two presentations in English.
The first one from newly avalas on good practices of gender equality in Spain and the second one from Nadine Dieter on good practices in Germany.
And we will conclude that session with a short opening of the exhibition exhibition is already set in the background.
And this 3D in the printed program is actually not 3DS3 dimensions but 3D for 3DS in the name of three of us who were mainly in charge of putting the exhibition together.
And.
Will have just a brief presentation of that.
Followed by the lunch.
Like after the lunch break, we'll focus a bit more on gender equality in Slovenia.
First, the presentation by Violeta Neubauer about efforts of office for equal opportunities, experiences, and challenges they have.
Then Martha Yogen presenting gender equality in research organizations.
What is the research doing Zofia Clement crack?
Presenting about recognizing importance of gender equality in Slovenia or little bit of historical dimension.
And we will conclude today's workshop with a roundtable on different means for achieving gender equality.
And roundtable is just informal discussion here.
A few of the speakers.
Where asked all the speakers actually were asked to.
Prepare some starting points for the discussion.
Maybe a PowerPoint slide.
If they wish.
I also have a few myself, so the idea is just to open up discussion and exchange ideas based on what we have heard through the day in general on international level and about Slovenian specifics.
